description: From French litre, from Medieval Latin litra, from Ancient Greek λίτρα (lítra, “a Sicilian coin, a measure of weight”). Related to Latin libra. Doublet of rottol.

entries.meaning: The metric unit of fluid measure, equal to one cubic decimetre. Symbols: l, L, ℓ
examples: You should be able to fill four cups with one litre of water.

entries.meaning: (informal) A measure of volume equivalent to a litre.
